The instructions are in the order in which they need to be completed.<n><n>1. Create an empty class called Person and an empty class called Student 2. Give each class two methods: a) A Person class which takes a title as an input and prints a "What you prefer to do?" question b) A Student class which take a number between 0 and 1 as an input and prints the number of hours you have worked as an intern c) A new method in each class which reads the user input and prints the output message based on the inputs<n>### Resources:<n>Navigate to [100 Days of Code](https://learn.co/courses/100-days-of-code-python) and click the button to begin the 100 Days of Python course.<n><n>### Inputs:<n>* Title input: "How do you define your work?"(Enter a value between 0 and 9)<n><n>### Outputs:<n>* Job Preferences: Choices: a) What do u enjoy more writing or making things b) what preferences when creating games c) what job u like to do in the future.<n><n>* Job Preferences 2: Choices:  a) doodling drawing designs  c) playing with my ideas  b) having fun while solving problems d) building the future e) creating my own things f) being social g) being alone<n><n>* Hours worked: 0 to 5 hours, 6 to 10 hours, 11 to 20 hours<n><n>* Student<n><n>* Job Preference 3<n>### Student Output<n>* Hours worked in an internship: Enter a value between 0 to 5

Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: He fantasied about getting a what while driving to work and the pros and cons of the extra responsibilities and benefits? Choices:  A: new car B: promotion C: boredom D: impatience E: pressure<n>Answer: B: promotion<n><n>Input: He was good at traditional science but excelled at social science, his favorite subject was what? Choices:  A: geography B: history studies C: math D: religion E: dancing<n>Answer: B: history studies<n><n>### Input:The city's community garden was demolished for yet another what? Choices:  A: wasteland B: ocean C: desert D: parking lot E: flowers<n><n>### Response:		E: flowers<n><n>## Solution<n>```<n>function multipleChoiceQuestion(str) {<n>    let splitString = str.split(" ");<n>    <n>    if(splitString[2] === "C" || splitString[3] === "D" || splitString[4] === "E")<n>  return splitString[0] == "He" || splitString[1] == "promotion" && splitString[2] == "impatience" && splitString[3] == "pressure" && splitString[4] == "flowers"<n>  else return false <n>}<n>```<n>

Choices:  A: orchestra B: baritone woodwind sound C: symphony D: play music E: high school band<n><n>### Response:		Where would you be able to be a part of a cacophony? <n><n>### Instructions:<n><n>* Write a complete function definition that takes an English word String[] as input, and returns a boolean value. <n><n>Your definition function should use the method `.matches()` to determine if the word matches the pattern, and if so, will return `true`, otherwise `false`.<n><n>```<n>import java.sql.*;<n>import java.util.*;<n>```<n><n>### Demostration:<n><n>* This is a method `contains()` with the signature `boolean test(String str)`. It should use the method `.split(“ ”)` to break the input str into pieces, and then check if any of the pieces (String pieces) exist in the String[] string[] to see if it contains the word.<n>```<n>public static boolean contains(String str)<n>	{<n>		String [] stringArray = str.split(" ");<n>		if (!Arrays.asList(stringArray).contains(" "))<n>		{<n>			return true;<n>		}<n>		return false;<n>	}<n>```<n><n>* This is the method `check(String [] str)`. In order to use the code above, define and initialize `Boolean result` as `false`, then call the method `contains()` with `str` as the argument.<n>```<n>public boolean check(String[] str)<n>    {<n>        Boolean result = false;<n>        for(int k = 0; k < str.length; k++){<n>            result= check(str[k]);<n>        }<n>        return result;<n>    }<n>``` <n><n>* This is an empty method called `test(String[] str)`. Call the method `contains()` and, if it returns `true`,  call the method `result= true`, then return `result`. <n><n><n>* Main `test` called `check`. The `if ( check(str, 0) == true )` can be combined into `if(check(str) == true)`, with the `== true` being unnecessary.

Choices:  A: suitcase B: filing cabinet C: computer D: desk drawer E: cloud<n><n>### Response:		<n>```<n>Please choose carefully.<n>There are plenty of pros and cons of being promoted.<n>If you're promoted, you'll have more responsibilities and more money.<n>However, you'll also have far more stress and higher requirements to please your boss and team.<n>You'll no longer be able to just go out of town and do whatever you want.<n>Now you'll have to take responsibility for yourself and the entire team.<n><n>```<n>You may also consider your job's specifics.<n>Sometimes companies pay your rent.<n>If you work near downtown and drive, consider keeping your new car,<n>but if you work in a suburb and commute by bus and train,<n>a promotion may require getting a new car or taking public transportation instead.<n><n>### Additional Information: The prompt indicates that the user has a file in an online cloud storage device.<n><n>##### A: Suitcase<n><n>Suitcases were once a common choice for keeping a digital file.<n>Nowadays cloud services are more convenient,<n>and many people now store their files in the cloud instead of a physical location.<n>It could be a disadvantage if this device is lost.<n><n>##### B: Filing Cabinet<n><n>You may need to find physical space for your new files.<n>Using a filing cabinet would be a quick and easy solution.<n>If your files aren't very large,<n>you could keep them in a drawer in your home or in a safe at your office.<n>Keeping your files on a filing cabinet is best for small-sized files.<n><n>##### C: Computer<n><n>Computers are the most convenient and secure digital storage container.<n>Files can easily be backed up, so you'll be able to access your work no matter what happens.<n>Computer crashes and physical breakage like a USB or HD are almost never an issue.<n><n>##### D: Desk Drawer<n><n>Many people store files in their desk drawer to prevent them from wandering off.<n>It offers more immediate access than other options,<n>but if your desk is broken or someone picks the lock and steals your files,<n>then you have a big problem.<n><n>##### E: Cloud<n><n>A cloud storage application can protect your data from hackers and natural disasters.<n>Having multiple devices and a user

After the user guesses, a random number between 1 and 5 of the same sort<n><n>For example, if the actual number were: "4"<n>The following results would occur:<n><n>15% chance of getting correct<n>20% chance of getting one off<n>40% chance of getting two off<n><n>If the number is larger than the guessed number, after the guess:<n><n>15%% chance of getting correct<n>70%% chance of getting two off, or 1 off<n>10%% chance off getting three off<n><n>If the guess is larger than the number is, after the guess: <n><n>45%% chance of getting close<n>15%% chance on getting one off<n>10%% of getting two off<n>10%% getting three off
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: He fantasied about getting a what while driving to work and the pros and cons of the extra responsibilities and benefits? Choices:  A: new car B: promotion C: boredom D: impatience E: pressure<n>Answer: B: promotion<n><n>Input: He was good at traditional science but excelled at social science, his favorite subject was what? Choices:  A: geography B: history studies C: math D: religion E: dancing<n>Answer: B: history studies<n><n>### Input:He had a hard time finding the room on his schedule, it was on the second floor and he got lost in the very large what? Choices:  A: school B: office building C: house D: hotel E: centre<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>```powershell<n>$Promotion = "B"<n>$subject = "history studies" <n>$room = "room on his schedule" <n>$Schedule = "second floor and he got lost <n><n>if ($Schedule = $room)<n>    {$Schedule = "Schedule Room" <n>    $Schedule = $HistoryStudies | Select -Unique | sort -Uniq | Select -SortObject | Remove -Duplicates    <n>    $Schedule}<n>```<n><n><n>### Expected Result:<n>$HistoryStudied | Select -Unique<n><n>#### Coded Solution:<n><n>```powershell<n>#Import-Module $module\Script<n><n>#Write your powershell code below<n><n>#Begin Output<n>#Promotion, HistoryStudies, ScheduleRoom, ScheduledRoom<n>#A, B, B, B<n><n>$Promotion = Get-Random "A","B","C","D","E"<n>$subject = Get-Random "History","Math","Geography","Social","Religion","Dance"<n>$room = Get-Random "Schedule","Schedule"<n>$Schedule = Get-Random "Second Floor","Room on his schedule","Center","office Building","School","Hotel"<n><n>if ($Schedules = $room)<n>        { $Schedules = $HistoryStudied| Select -Unique | Sort -Uniq | Select SortObject | Remove Duplicates<n>        $Schedules<n>        <n>#End Output<n>```<n>### Submitting a Solution<n>1. You can also submit a GitHub repository containing your solution in the form of a zip file containing a powershell project directory with your solution.

Choices:  A: age grieving person B: heart attacks C: depression D: hair loss E: headache<n><n>### Response:		<n>B) A) grieving person B) age C) loss D) depression E) hair loss<n>The only thing that could result in death by grief is depression, which is classified as a mental health disorder. Depression could cause anxiety, nervousness, irritability, sadness, and even grief, but grief can be managed and doesn't have long lasting effects while depression is much more serious.<n><n>### Challenge:<n>Input:You shouldn't talk to others while doing what. For multiple choice questions, multiple responses can all be written on one line and separated by a semicolon. All responses should be fully justified.<n><n><n><n>### Input description:<n><n>Input description of your solution.<n>If the input is text, then the response should be text.<n>If the input requires multiple selections (multiple choice),<n>make a list of all potential answers that include the full text in brackets, and use commas for each added entry.<n>Your list may have any number of entries, but the overall response to the input should be one unnumbered line<n><n>### Output description:<n><n>Output description of what your answer should be.<n>If the output is text, then your response to the input should only be text.<n>If your output requires multiple selections (see below), you may include the same instructions as input in your response.<n>Also, include all of the chosen responses for your input and specify<n>which answer the output should choose by including the string the answer should choose in the brackets (e.g A: [the answer you want chosen]).<n>Your choice should be written on the same unnumbered line of the output.<n><n>### Example:<n><n>### Answer<n>

Select the best option that will complete it according to the passage.<n><n>A great white shark can weigh up to 5,000 pounds and grow up to 22 feet. For 5.5 million years, great white sharks have been the ocean's most efficient predators. They live in the world's cold ocean waters and they eat almost anything, but their most vulnerable preys are seals and seal pups. They will go after anything in the ocean that they consider food even baleen whales, sea turtles, dolphins, and even humans and their gear.<n><n>They are very social creatures and have been known to travel in schools with over 200 sharks at a time. They are also very territorial, and can travel up to 40 miles to find new territory or an established feeding ground. Their teeth are sharper than knives and can cut through up to 1,000 pounds of flesh in just a few minutes, even up to a boat.<n><n>After reading the passage, you will find a sentence with some text missing. Select the appropriate option to complete the sentence.<n><n>**Its speed is a**.<n><n>**The shark is the**.<n><n>**I've seen them in the**.<n><n>1. They're the apex predator in the ocean.<n>2. They have 300 teeth, which are replaced every seven years.<n>3. They live for 2,200 years in the cold ocean waters.<n>4. They can weigh up to over 5,00o pounds and have a body up to 22' long.<n>

Choices:  A: new car B: promotion C: boredom D: impatience E: pressure<n>Answer: B: promotion<n><n>Input: He was good at traditional science but excelled at social science, his favorite subject was what? Choices:  A: geography B: history studies C: math D: religion E: dancing<n>Answer: B: history studies<n><n>### Input:Where is the strategic gold reserve in the U.S.? Choices:  A: jewelery B: fort knox C: church D: jewelry store E: treasure chest<n><n>### Response:		<n>The answer is b but we don't believe D or E would be a correct answer?

Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: He fantasied about getting a what while driving to work and the pros and cons of the extra responsibilities and benefits? Choices:  A: new car B: promotion C: boredom D: impatience E: pressure<n>Answer: B: promotion<n><n>Input: He was good at traditional science but excelled at social science, his favorite subject was what? Choices:  A: geography B: history studies C: math D: religion E: dancing<n>Answer: B: history studies<n><n>### Input:Where would there be a connection to go to another place? Choices:  A: wires B: electrical circuit C: computer network D: wall E: freeway<n><n>### Response:		<n>Inside the wall, there will be a connection to go anywhere else. It is the wires that connect to the electrical circuit. There is a freeway too.<n><n>### Output:The difference between a wall and a wallpaper is?<n><n>### Demystification:  There are three things that are in a room. The walls are used to decorate it and are made of dry-walled plaster/bricks whereas,  wallpapers are wall coverings. A wall usually has a door while a wallpaper doesn't. A wallpaper is a covering while a wall is a structure that creates a separate space between 2 or more places. <n><n><n>### Output<n>Walls are used to decorate a room or place. There is a way to make a wall with different materials like bricks and dry-walled plaseters but, there isn't a wallpaper. The wallpaper is meant for decoration like a wall but it is lighter to carry than a wall. Walls usually have a door unlike wallpapers.<n><n><n>### Response<n>Inside a freeway, there would be a connection to go elsewhere. A connection is a wire made of many wires and is a means to go to another place, freeways are highways that allow the use of a car for transportation and are made of roads which can lead somewhere. A wire allows electricity through which is a connection to go to electricity. The difference between a freeway and a freeway is that a freeway can connect to another freeway. It has nothing to do with the location. The location is where the connection is. A freeway is not an answer to the question.<n><n>#### Input:What material would make a good cover for an area rug? Choices: <n>A: leather B: lint C: polyester D: silk E: suede<n><n>#### Response:<n>Lint is light and soft. But, the good material for an are rug is silk as it is also long lasting.<n><n>#### Output:What material would a materially, aesthetically and environmentally appropriate material?Choices:A: leather B lint C: polyurethane D: silk E. Suede<n><n>#### Demystification:<n>The material which can be used outside the rug or as a cover for the

Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: He fantasied about getting a what while driving to work and the pros and cons of the extra responsibilities and benefits? Choices:  A: new car B: promotion C: boredom D: impatience E: pressure<n>Answer: B: promotion<n><n>Input: He was good at traditional science but excelled at social science, his favorite subject was what? Choices:  A: geography B: history studies C: math D: religion E: dancing<n>Answer: B: history studies<n><n>### Input:What do customers do in a store? Choices:  A: hunt B: pay merchants with money C: mail orders D: spend money E: demand satisfaction<n><n>### Response:		<n>A store is a place of sale, trade, or business. It is an establishment at a particular location that sells goods or services. We may find it in various settings (retail) such as<n>- street shop<n>- Department store, convenience store<n>- Large shop selling a range of goods, such as electronics, food, clothing<n>- Restaurant, cafe<n>In a store customers do (are supposed to do) the following<n>- **hunt** products for purchase<n>- **pay merchants** with money<n>- **mail order** for convenience and to save time/money<n>- **demand satisfaction** from the vendors<n><n>### Instructions: <n><n>Below are some descriptions; select the correct answer.<n><n>### Description A: <n><n>Bill’s family’s car broke down. He’s not sure what to do—try driving it around town to see if it starts. He doesn’t think it will. He’s too hot to walk for a long distance.<n><n>### Response A: <n><n>The answer I can choose is  A: **Try to start the car**.<n>	<n>### Description B:<n><n>After buying flowers today, Bill saw a cute girl in the parking lot. While walking to the car, he realized she had taken his flowers. Bill waited until she came out of the store, and then tried to give her the flowers back. She looked at Bill, and then walked away. <n><n>### Response B: <n><n>the answer I can choose is **cute girl in the parkin lot**<n><n>### Description C:<n><n>Bill looked at the flowers, and felt upset. He’ll probably have to buy some more flowers tomorrow. He needs to tell his wife he has been in an accident.<n><n>### Resons C:<n><n>the answer I could choose is **tell his wife he has been an accident**<n><n>### Insturctions:<n><n>Below is a set of statements about the events happening in each story. Choose the answer that describes what would best happen next.<n><n>### Story A<n><n>### The girl takes the flowers<n><n>### The boy apologizes in a loud and angry voice<n><n>### The mother is very angry<n><n>### The cops arrest Bill<n><n>##

Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: He fantasied about getting a what while driving to work and the pros and cons of the extra responsibilities and benefits? Choices:  A: new car B: promotion C: boredom D: impatience E: pressure<n>Answer: B: promotion<n><n>Input: He was good at traditional science but excelled at social science, his favorite subject was what? Choices:  A: geography B: history studies C: math D: religion E: dancing<n>Answer: B: history studies<n><n>### Input:The star had 4 rocky planets and 4 gaseous planets orbiting it, what was it part of Choices:  A: hollywood B: night sky C: constellation D: aliens E: solar system<n><n>### Response:		<n>A star and constellation are both parts of the night sky.<n><n>### Input 2:An artist made a masterpiece and a copy was not as original as the original Choices:  A what did she do? B: copied it B: created a copy C: created an original artwork herself D: sold it to a gallery owner C is a good choice because it is not as original as the other one.<n><n>### Response 2:Create a function that accepts any string, creates a new string using the original string as a template, and outputs the new string.<n><n>### Example:<n><n>`inputString = "hey hey hey"`<n><n>`outputToSend = createFromOriginalTemplate(inputString)`<n><n>### Conclusion:<n>```<n>He thought of getting a new car while driving to work, the pros were the new vehicle had low rates of accidents and the cons were that he would need to take it in for repairs.<n>```
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: He fantasied about getting a what while driving to work and the pros and cons of the extra responsibilities and benefits? Choices:  A: new car B: promotion C: boredom D: impatience E: pressure<n>Answer: B: promotion<n><n>Input: He was good at traditional science but excelled at social science, his favorite subject was what? Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: He fantasied about getting a what while driving to work and the pros and cons of the extra responsibilities and benefits? Choices:  A: new car B: promotion C: boredom D: impatience E: pressure<n>Answer: B: promotion<n><n>Input: He was good at traditional science but excelled at social science, his favorite subject was what? Choices:  A: geography B: history studies C: math D: religion E: dancing<n>Answer: B: history studies<n><n>### Input:What kind of place could have thousands of statue? Choices:  A: church B: theatre C: large city D: water fountain E: central park<n><n>### Response:		A: church<n><n>### Instructions:<n>Write a program that accepts an integer as the user's guess. The program should accept the number entered by the user until the user provides an invalid number, in which case the program will end. Note that the number entered by the program should be an int and that the program should not loop around until the user enters a valid number which is larger than the target value.<n><n>### Idea:<n>The idea is to let the user try an invalid number. That invalid number should be stored and compared to the number entered when valid, the program should end when the program identifies the invalid number. The program does not wait on the invalid number. The invalid number, and the entry, are compared in the check if () block so that the program will end when the invalid number is found.<n><n>### Input : The program will ask a user to enter a number, which will get stored in an integer variable. The program will compare that variable against a value. The program will compare the variable entered against a target value provided by the user in the main method.<n><n>### Solution :<n>The program should ask the user to enter a number and store it in an integer variable called guess.<n><n>The program will then store the target value in a variable called number target. The target value comes from a method which gets the number from a user.<n>The program will then compare if(x >= guess) comparing the guess to the number target.<n><n>The program should loop as long as guess is less than number target (until an invalid number (guess) is entered)<n><n>The first loop should allow the user an opportunity to guess a different number (by pressing the up button). The program will store the guess in an integer variable called newguess.<n><n>The program then compares newguess against the number target. If the guess is less than or equal to number target the program should output the message "You Win" and ask the user to enter another number (by pressing the down button). The program should then store the newnewguess integer in the guess variable.<n><n>The next loop should allow the user to exit by pressing the down button.<n><n>### Expected Outputs:<n>The expected output in the first question would be "You loss." in the second it would be "The answer is 1184." and the last would read "Too Low"<n><n>### Ex

Choices:  A: new car B: promotion C: boredom D: impatience E: pressure<n>Answer: B: promotion<n><n>Input: He was good at traditional science but excelled at social science, his favorite subject was what? Choices:  A: geography B: history studies C: math D: religion E: dancing<n>Answer: B: history studies<n><n>### Input:Though he could've kept going his body appreciated the rest, it had been constantly what during the day? Choices:  A: walk B: lay down C: working D: moving E: exercise<n><n>### Response:		<n>#### 1. What did he fantasize about getting?<n>   > I think he fantasized about getting a promotion.<n><n>#### 2. He was good at what?<n>   > He was good at traditional sciences.<n><n>#### 3. His favorite subject was what?<n>   > His favorite subject was history studies.<n><n>#### 4. It appreciatied rest, it had been<n>   > It appreciated being laid down.<n>

Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: He fantasied about getting a what while driving to work and the pros and cons of the extra responsibilities and benefits? Choices:  A: new car B: promotion C: boredom D: impatience E: pressure<n>Answer: B: promotion<n><n>Input: He was good at traditional science but excelled at social science, his favorite subject was what? Choices:  A: geography B: history studies C: math D: religion E: dancing<n>Answer: B: history studies<n><n>### Input:How does getting paid feel? Choices:  A: income tax B: satisfaction C: sorrow D: ocean E: bill collectors to happy<n><n>### Response:		<n>```<n>B<n>E<n>B<n>E<n>D<n>```<n><n>### Instructions:  Answer the following multiple choice question<n><n>### Demo:<n>Input:Which of these animals is the most like the bull terrier, the poodle, or the beagle? Choices: 1: the bull terrier 2: the poodle 3: the beagle 4: neither dog 5: none<n>Answer: D: none<n><n>Input:Dogs are classified as what? Choices:1: primates<n>2: pets<n>3: cows<n>4: wolves<n>5: none of the above<n>Answer: 5: none of the answers<n><n>### Instructios:<n>```<n>E<n>A<n>B<n>C<n>E<n>```<n><n><n>### Instuctions:<n>```<n>D<n>Written Response:  In this week's demonstration, a person is asked whether he had a fantasy or a dream about a new car, got a promotion, or was bored by tradition. It is clear that he does not want the first option, as it involves responsibility like a loan and insurance. He is also skeptical of promotion, as it comes with extra pressure and potential for failure. Finally, he is not interested in having a fantasy as it does not involve any real decision-making process. However, it is evident that he desires some sense of satisfaction and accomplishment in his life. As such, it is most likely that he will choose Option E: pressure.<n>```<n><n><n>

It is widely distributed in Southern Canada, the United States, Central America, South America and parts of the Caribbean Islands. The bobcat has an average size of 24–26 in (61–66 cm) long and weighs 27–40 lb (12–18 kg). Its chest is 25–29 in (63.5–74 cm) long. It has small legs with five toes on each foot, with the first and second largest. Its tail measures 7–9 in (18–23 cm). The bobcat has short, soft fur. Its coat is yellowish-brown on top and pale grayish underneath. The bobcat usually appears gray-yellowish to graybrown in color. The bobcat's large, rounded ears have black patches on the back, and its short legs have slightly longer hair on the outside. <n>### The bobcat is found in many different habitat types, including deserts, woodlands, farm fields, and swamps, and near residential areas. Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: He fantasied about getting a what while driving to work and the pros and cons of the extra responsibilities and benefits? Choices:  A: new car B: promotion C: boredom D: impatience E: pressure<n>Answer: B: promotion<n><n>Input: He was good at traditional science but excelled at social science, his favorite subject was what? Choices:  A: geography B: history studies C: math D: religion E: dancing<n>Answer: B: history studies<n><n>### Input:How is someone who loves their TV likely to feel about their remote? Choices:  A: attached B: nostalgic C: companionable D: likely E: close<n><n>### Response:		A remote that is attached is one that is stuck to the person.<n>[![Tip](https://img.shields.io/badge/Support-Pure.Ink-blue.svg)](https://github.com/DylanRodriguez/Pure.Ink "For Question help and support")<n><n>### Solution:<n>```javascript<n>  const instruction = 'He fantasied about getting'<n>  const options = ['a new car', 'a promotion', <n>'boredom', 'impatience', 'pressure']<n>  const answer = ''<n>  const demonstration = 'Input: He fantasized about getting what while driving to work?'<n>  const demonstration_answer = 'Answer: B: promotion'<n>  const multiple_choice = 'Demonstration:How is someone who enjoys their TV likely to feel'<n>  const multiple = ['with the remote', 'about their remote', 'with remotes', 'about remotes']<n>  const solution = option => {<n>    if (option === answer){<n>      return demonstration + '.' + demonstration_answer + '.'<n>    } else {<n>      return (<n>        'Option'+ option + ','+ demonstration_answer = <n>        'does not equal the answer'+ demonstration_answers)<n>    }<n>  }<n><n>  //console.log(solution(multiple_choice));<n>  console.log(solution('a'))<n>  console.log('______________________________________________')<n>  console.log (solution('b'))<n>  console.print("________")<n>  console.log ('Test' in solution)<n>```<n>

Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: He fantasied about getting a what while driving to work and the pros and cons of the extra responsibilities and benefits? Choices:  A: new car B: promotion C: boredom D: impatience E: pressure<n>Answer: B: promotion<n><n>Input: He was good at traditional science but excelled at social science, his favorite subject was what? Choices:  A: geography B: history studies C: math D: religion E: dancing<n>Answer: B: history studies<n><n>### Input:John had a lot of respect for Jill, but not many other people did.  She faced a lot of what? Choices:  A: ignoring B: being rude C: disparagement D: contumely E: uncertainty<n><n>### Response:		"Disparagement" is a strong word and it is a good idea to write your response in that way since it could be one of the many possible answers. The response should be in the form of a paragraph with a sentence or two to introduce the main paragraph.<n><n>### Explanation:You should take the time to explain the reason you want to do this. You can use "because:" at the beginning of a sentence to indicate the reason.<n><n>### Example:<n>You can answer many questions in this manner. Choices:  A: farmland B: neighborhood C: city D: property E: subdivision<n><n>### Response:		<n>The requester is asking if a yard that is tiny might be in a farmland, neighborhood, city, property, subdivision or the property that he is interested in is the one or if it is the one. The task is incomplete and the requester wants a choice to be selected from a small set of choices, the answers which satisfy the task requirement are **A** where a yard can be tiny in farmland, **B** where a yard can also be tiny in a neighborhood, **C** where a yard can even be tiny in a city, **D** where a yard can become tiny in a property that is used for development, **E** in a subdivision where yards are often relatively tiny, and **F** where the yard might be in a development that has already been built up which means the yards are already tiny.<n><n>### <n>The requester is suggesting that a yard if is tiny which is most preferable to him. If the yard is in what he is considering buying is very tiny compared to a house with big backyard, then the buyer is most probably a person who values privacy which is a good buyer since a house with a backyard is more prone to interventions of neighbors. Alternatively, the requester wants what?<n>A: More privacy B: A backyard C D: None E: Some yard<n><n>Answer: A: More privacy<n><n>**Instruction:Answer the following short answer question.**<n>**Demonstration:**<n><n>Input: How many piles of garbage would be left in the house after we removed this heap of it? There was a target on the wall for him to bounce against.  Where might he be? Choices:  A: pool table B: toy box C: playroom D: park E: closet<n><n>### Response:		D: playroom<n><n>### Input He was playing the drums and he banged out a tune.<n><n>### Response He was playing the drums.<n><n>I used the code below, but when the instructions were run, the word drums wasn't underlined.  Do you think since you are not answering multiple choice questions correctly, that it's not underlining the word.?<n>This worked when I had the computer run the script without using Watson's help.  So do you think that the word 'drums' still could be in 'A sentence' and still underlined?<n>```javascript<n>let answer = (prompt) => {<n>  let split = prompt.split(" ")<n>  let string = prompt<n>  let word = prompt<n>  let nouns = ["daughter","apple", "apple_juice", "drums", "shoes", "cat", "box"]<n>  let answer = ""<n>for (let i = 0; i < nouns.length; i++) {<n>  answer = (string.includes(nouns[i]))<n>      if (answer) {<n>        for (let j = 0; j < nouns.toString().length; j++) {<n>          var substring = string === nouns[i]<n>          if (substring === true) {<n>            return answer<n>          }<n>        }<n>        string = (string)<n>      }<n>}<n>return answer<n>}<n>let user = {name: "Billy Bob"}<n>alert(answer(user.name))<n>```

Shall<n>* 2. Will<n>* 3. It's the way to drive a car<n>* 4. A way to communicate<n><n>### Demostration:<n><n>### Input 1:<n>- I will be arriving home late tonight. I have to be at the airport at midnight.<n><n>### Input2:<n>- We will not be going in until the storm is passed.<n><n>### The question<n>- *Answer 1: What is tense is correct (not 'tenses') because the sentence uses the form: ***WONT'S 'WERE 'SHALL, SHOULD or 'WI'LL***.<n><n>### Answer:<n>- A. Shall<n><n>### Input<n>- Tomorrow is a good day for us to have a picnic.<n><n>### Response<n>- The answer is "It's tomorrow, and you can say 'Tomorrow we'll have a picnic'". *Note that 'we'll' implies it is the future.<n><n>### Your Answer:<n><n>### Demo:

Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: He fantasied about getting a what while driving to work and the pros and cons of the extra responsibilities and benefits? Choices:  A: new car B: promotion C: boredom D: impatience E: pressure<n>Answer: B: promotion<n><n>Input: He was good at traditional science but excelled at social science, his favorite subject was what? Choices:  A: geography B: history studies C: math D: religion E: dancing<n>Answer: B: history studies<n><n>### Input:His running escape didn't last long once he tripped, perhaps he should've thought to what? Choices:  A: tie shoelace B: rest C: tiredness D: run longer E: sit down<n><n>### Response:		<n>```<n>import random<n><n>def get_question():<n>    ans = random.randint(1,5)<n>    if ans == 1:<n>        print("You are a good student of geography and you might be interested in traveling to a new place. Which one you will visit?")<n>        return (input(""))<n>    if ans ==2:<n>        print("Which is the heaviest element?")<n>        return((input("Ans:")))<n>    if ans ==3:<n>        print("What number, if repeated twice, becomes fifty?")<n>        return()<n>    if ans ==4:<n>        print("His running escape didnâ??t last long once he slipped, might he be the last place he should have run to for some rest and refreshment?")<n>        return("Sit down")<n>    return(ans,"")<n>```<n>

Name five interesting facts about the sun. [answer]:<n><n>- The sun is our closest star- the distance is about 93 million miles.<n>    - The sun has two sun-spots where there is less hot gas on the surface.<n>    - There is a solar eclipse every year or so.<n>    - The life of a sun-spot is about 5 weeks.<n>    - The only planet we know of that has spots similar to the sun is Mercury.<n><n>- The sun has a cycle where it changes brightness from its longest days to the shortest days.<n>- There are about 200,000,00,00 solar flares a year that send rays of the sun out to the solar system.<n>- About 60,000 people are directly killed each year directly from sun-burns<n>- Scientists have discovered five different types of stars- the sun is one of those.<n><n><n>Question 2. What do you think the answer is? I was only thinking about the size of our sun.<n>I thought about the answers after I wrote them down. I would be a scientist if I was smart and good with science.<n><n>

Choices:  A: trunk B: drawer C: suitcase D: book shelf E: washing machine<n><n>### Response:		<n>1. What would the response to this question be?<n>2. Write your response to 1 question<n>3. What are the pros and cons of having a car?<n><n>### Output:<n>The answer to prompt 1 is B: Promotion.<n>The answer to prompts 2, 3, and 4 are: The best thing about promotions is, you get more responsibilities, however you can also gain more benefits.<n><n>### Input 2:<n>2. What would be the answer to the questions that asks where people find old clothes?<n>4. Anything else you would like to know?<n>3. The answer to question 2 is C: suitcase.<n><n>### Output 2:<n>The answer to question 3 is A: anything.<n><n>### Question:<n>What are the pros and cons for getting a new car vs getting a promotion?<n><n>### Instructions:<n>Write 2-3 sentences about getting cars. Each sentence must use one of the bulleted sentences below.<n><n>### Bulleted Sentences:<n>Getting a new car is better.<n>Getting a car used to get you places faster.<n>Getting a new used car can save you some money.<n>Getting a used car isn’t as common.<n>Getting a promotion makes you feel proud.<n>Getting a job you are skilled in means more hours means more money.<n>The pay at your current job is low.<n>Your current job has few responsibilities.<n><n><n>### Output<n>What I learned from doing this:<n>The bulleted sentences helped.<n><n>### Response<n>Writing a complete response did the opposite.<n><n>### Task 3<n><n>### Input<n>The person was telling a lie when he said he loved eating vegetables. What was his lie? A)he didn’t know what to say B) he said the truth.<n><n>### Demo<n>1. What would be the correct answer to the question?<n>2. He did so because he was feeling what? Choices:  A: pleasure B: delight C: bankruptcy D: agony E: owning<n><n>### Response:		A: Pleasure<n><n>### Instructions:<n>You may use any of the libraries or commands presented in your Python course.<n><n>### Task:<n><n>Create a program that creates a simple quiz on various things.<n><n>The quiz should ask the quiz taker a question and give them multiple choice options to select the answer.<n><n>A wrong answer will prompt the user to rerun it and try again.<n><n>A correct answer will give the user their answer. <n><n>You should be able to run the program normally and have the quiz taker answer questions as normal, then rerun it, and then have it correct/incorrect.<n><n>For example when this program is run with just `python quiz.py` you should receive the prompt and then the questions as follows with the options listed below: <n><n>- What was your favorite color as a kid? - - - Choices: Red, Blue, Green<n><n>Your choice: 1/ Blue<n><n>- What is 2 + 2? - - - Choice: 4<n><n>Your choice: Correct!<n><n>- Did you like being a kid? - - Choice: Yes, No<n>Your choice: No<n><n>The program should now present the user with the following:<n><n>Type any number to repeat a question<n><n>Type quit to end the program<n><n>Type help to help<n><n>Type list to show all the questions<n><n>Type space to pause<n><n>Type enter to answer<n><n>Once the user inputs a repeated question the program will run the question again<n><n>once the user enters quit the program will exit.<n><n>if the user enters help, the program will present a list of the available options (this should not run the quiz again)<n><n>If the user enters space or enter during a question the question will be treated as input. <n><n>If they enter any other key (except repeat, help, and quit) an error should be printed and they should be asked to enter help<n><n>Note that the user is not allowed to use space or enter to try to end the program, to do that they must type quit or they will be presented with  an error statement<n><n>### Output:<n>The following table summarizes potential output.<n><n>Input and Output Example<n><n><n>### Sample Output:<n><n>Quick start<n><n>```<n>python3.6 quiz.py 0.0

Below is an instruction that describes a task. Choices:  A: new car B: promotion C: boredom D: impatience E: pressure<n>Answer: B: promotion<n><n>Input: He was good at traditional science but excelled at social science, his favorite subject was what? Choices:  A: geography B: history studies C: math D: religion E: dancing<n>Answer: B: history studies<n><n>### Input:The accelerator was controller via a hand throttle, and the foot pedals controlled the steering in the small what? Choices:  A: car B: fuel system C: accelerate D: boat E: airplane<n><n>### Response:		<n>```python<n>def Answer(input, demonstration):<n>   input = input()<n>   demonstration = demonstration()<n>   if input == "A":<n>   return "A : A boat."<n>   elif input == "B":<n>   return "B : A car."<n>   elif input<n>  = "C":<n>  return  "C : A fuel system."<n>   elif input =="D":<n>  return "D: An airplane."<n>   else:<n>  return False<n>```<n>### Input:He fantasied about getting A what<n> ### while driving to work<n>### and the pros and cons<n>### the extra responsibilities<n>### and benefits?<n>        #The function should return A,B,C,D<n>        <n><n>### Question:<n>1)What are lists in python <n><n>2)What are the three lists that we use in python and how?<n><n><n>### Input<n><n>In your input, define a sentence which contains a set of words that you want to remove. The list of words that you want removed is provided to you in the input string. You will need to tell us what the sentence without removing the specified <n>words are and what word was removed from the sentence. (If you remove one or more words, your output should be the remaining words in the sentence.)<n><n>### Demostration:<n><n>def main():<n>  sentence = 'It is easy to do simple tasks in python. '<n>  for list in (['simple', 'task', 'in', 'python']):<n>  print(sentence.replace(list[0],''))<n>  print(sentance.replace(list[index],' '))<n>#   index stands for the index of the number of the corresponding word to replace.<n>#   i=0 is the index of the 1st index, i=1 is the index of the second index,<n>#                           i=2 is the index of the third and so on and so forth.<n><n><n>### Instructions:<n><n>  <n>In this question, define input sentences which have words you want to remove and write the output statement that prints the sentences without removing any word mentioned by you.<n><n><n>## #Write a function named  remove_sentence(input). Choices:  A: being married B: sisters C: marriage D: two people E: lawyer<n><n>### Response:		The answer is being married.<n><n>### Input<n>In the next paragraph, an example is given. Write the corresponding response to complete the example, so that it makes sentence.<n><n>### Answer<n><n>"A person looking to make an annual income of 10000 dollars can choose to work in a grocery store, in a factory, or as a lawyer.  If you choose the grocery store, you'll most likely make the least money, and in the factory you'll probably make some money, but as a lawyer you can earn more than two thousand dollars".<n>"What is the income earner in the last sentence choosing to be?"<n><n>### Demystifing<n>"A person looking at making an annual income of 200 thousand dollars can choose to work, as an architect, engineer, or as a professional athlete.  If you choose to be an architect, you'll almost certainly earn the least money, and as an engineer you'll probably earn enough to survive, but as professional athlete you can earn considerably more than 200 thousand".<n><n>### Instructions: Answer the question.<n><n>## Demonstration<n>You can write a response only if the word you find in the first line will always be repeated in the two sentences after it.<n>## Input<n>"If you choose to be a lawyer, you'll"<n><n>## Answer<n><n>If you choose to be an engineer, you will"<n>" If you choose to be a businessman, you might"<n><n>## Demystification<n><n>"If you choose a career in a factory, you could"<n><n>

Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: He fantasied about getting a what while driving to work and the pros and cons of the extra responsibilities and benefits? Choices:  A: new car B: promotion C: boredom D: impatience E: pressure<n>Answer: B: promotion<n><n>Input: He was good at traditional science but excelled at social science, his favorite subject was what? Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: He fantasied about getting a what while driving to work and the pros and cons of the extra responsibilities and benefits? Choices:  A: new car B: promotion C: boredom D: impatience E: pressure<n>Answer: B: promotion<n><n>Input: He was good at traditional science but excelled at social science, his favorite subject was what? Choices:  A: geography B: history studies C: math D: religion E: dancing<n>Answer: B: history studies<n><n>### Input:The cabinets were imported from the south. John bought they because he knew that they would look good.  Where might they be installed? Choices:  A: kitchen B: pantry C: containing pots and pans D: in a flight E: mexico<n><n>### Response:		I'm thinking that the cabinets will be installed in the pantry. That way they can be used in a flight.<n><n>### Input<n>Ten years ago, he could have chosen whether or not he wanted a job with high income and very little control over his schedule. The opportunity was not there. Today, the opportunity to have a that choice has vanished.<n><n>### Response<n><n>It has been a long time since I worked for someone. For that reason, I could not enjoy the time when I was given the choice of either job with high income and no control or a low income and job where I was able to control my time.<n><n>### Question:<n><n>Which of the following best describes a cause or the cause of an effect? The effect that I could choose to work for less money and spend most of my time at home.<n><n>### Answer:B: the cause of an effect<n><n>### Input (text)<n><n>When he arrived at his destination, he was overwhelmed by the beauty of the place. It seemed like one big city with an amazing selection of everything he could want. There were shopping malls and restaurants and stores around every corner.<n><n>### Incomplete sentence:<n><n>John found it to be the best city that he had ever been able to walk around.<n><n>### Complete sentences<n><n><n>* It was the best city that John had ever been in.<n>* It was the only city that John had ever walked through.<n>* It was only a part of the best city that I had ever had a chance to walk around.<n>* It was one of the only places that I had ever have walked through.<n>* He found it to be the most ideal city that he had ever had a chance of looking at.<n>* The city seemed like it was a lot farther than he had thought.<n><n>### Short answer:<n><n>Which part of the sentence is a cause?<n><n>* John arrived at his destination.<n>* He was overwhelmed.<n>* There were shopping mall and restaurants.<n>* It was a big deal.<n><n>None of the above<n><n>### Question<n><n>I think that the part which is most important in making a sentence is to get the sentence to make sense.<n><n>### Actions:<n><n>In a sentence, an action is either a verb or a noun

Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: He fantasied about getting a what while driving to work and the pros and cons of the extra responsibilities and benefits? Choices:  A: new car B: promotion C: boredom D: impatience E: pressure<n>Answer: B: promotion<n><n>Input: He was good at traditional science but excelled at social science, his favorite subject was what? Choices:  A: geography B: history studies C: math D: religion E: dancing<n>Answer: B: history studies<n><n>### Input:They were competing in basketball, the goal was to what? Choices:  A: bounce the ball B: competition C: have fun D: race E: score points<n><n>### Response:		<n>### Write 2 lines for each question<n>### Question:1.What are the benefits of a promotion?<n>### Response: The pros of a promotion are:<n>- It earns you a lot of money<n>- It increases your chance of finding a new job<n>- It increases your career options<n>- It boosts self esteem<n>### Responce: The cons of a promotion are<n>- It decreases your chances of winning a prize<n>- The risk of loosing the job<n>- The danger of making costly mistakes<n>- Too much responsibilities <n><n>### Question:3.The pros of a promotion are that you have more chances of finding a new job but the cons are it decreases your chances to win prizes.<n><n>### Question :You can choose any one type of response as your own<n>### Response :<n>- I like the benefits of getting a promotion because you can earn a lot of money but I hate the cons because you stand a lot of competition and you have to work extra hard and this can take away all the fun.<n>### or<n>- The pros of getting a promotion are you can earn a big salary, your job opportunities will be increased and you can get an appreciation from your employer.The cons that I hate are you can be demoted if you are careless and you might lose your job.<n>### You can also give multiple answers but each response should be no more than 32 words<n>### I like the benefits of new car and pressure because you can drive to a new place at ease, you can increase your family size by adding another car but pressure would always be there because you can’t afford something else if you buy a new car.<n>### Multiple choice questions should have 1 or 2 responses each<n>### You can choose any type of response as your best answer.<n>
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: He fantasied about getting a what while driving to work and the pros and cons of the extra responsibilities and benefits? Choices:  A: new car B: promotion C: boredom D: impatience E: pressure<n>Answer: B: promotion<n><n>Input: He was good at traditional science but excelled at social science, his favorite subject was what? Choices:  A: geography B: history studies C: math D: religion E: dancing<n>Answer: B: history studies<n><n>### Input:Where is a likely place to view an old copy machine? Choices:  A: industrial area B: museum C: barn D: school E: office<n><n>### Response:		<n>Write your response in the textbox below. Choices:  A: new car B: promotion C: boredom D: impatience E: pressure<n>Answer: B: promotion<n><n>Input: He was good at traditional science but excelled at social science, his favorite subject was what? Choices:  A: geography B: history studies C: math D: religion E: dancing<n>Answer: B: history studies<n><n>### Input:John's RV needs electricity so that he can cook lunch.  Where would he go to plug in? Choices:  A: toy store B: basement C: school D: rest area E: building<n><n>### Response:		John would go to the rest area.<n><n><n>### Instructions: <n>Create a function called "reward" and "punishment" that takes in three arguments: a number, an argument, and a choice, and returns the appropriate response. Note the following:<n><n>1.  A number should be a positive integer. For example, if there were a number 22, then a positive integer between 21 and 23 should be passed in as a number.<n>2.  A choice should either be uppercase or lowercase. A choice can be "Promotion" or "No Promotion". For example, if a promotion is chosen, the response should be "B". Likewise, if there is no promotion, the response should be 'A'.<n>3.  The return value of "reward" can be a string, "yes", indicating that the person should be promoted; a string, "no", indicating that no promotion should occur; or another positive integer.<n>4.  The return value for "punishment" should either be a string or a string of positive integers.<n>5.  The arguments for the function should be passed to the main function.<n><n>For example, if the number passed to reward is 22, the argument should be 'A' indicating that John is not getting a promotion, and a choice to the function should be 'P',  'N', or 'E'.<n><n>

Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: He fantasied about getting a what while driving to work and the pros and cons of the extra responsibilities and benefits? Choices:  A: new car B: promotion C: boredom D: impatience E: pressure<n>Answer: B: promotion<n><n>Input: He was good at traditional science but excelled at social science, his favorite subject was what? Choices:  A: geography B: history studies C: math D: religion E: dancing<n>Answer: B: history studies<n><n>### Input:Where are seats most likely bleachers? Choices:  A: movies B: opera C: theater D: lecture hall E: hockey game<n><n>### Response:		A: movies<n><n>### Instructions: Write the most effective command and its parameters to achieve the desired response. For this assignment, no more than four commands may be used. This problem may be split into multiple commands, but use the command and parameter structure above to guide the response.<n><n>> Note that if the input does not have valid parameters (no parameters, or invalid number of parameters, or invalid command), the solution should still output a valid, but incorrect, response.<n><n>### Input<n><n>I thought about going to the movies this weekend. The pros are bleachers. The cons are people yell during important moments.<n><n>Solution<n><n>> Note: You are not required to write code in HTML, but you should be able to understand the HTML so you can copy the markup in your solution. For this assignment, you must use a solution where each parameter contains only values that can be written as a single word (e.g., no compound words or abbreviations, use the shortest form of the word that allows you to understand the parameter)<n><n>Output<n><n>Hello. I am thinking of going to the movie theater this weekend. The  **pro** s to go to the movies are bleachers. There are several **con** s with going to the movies. The one that may be most important to consider is the audience is very **loud** sometimes. However, this can be reduced with the right seats and some patience.<n>

Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: He fantasied about getting a what while driving to work and the pros and cons of the extra responsibilities and benefits? Choices:  A: new car B: promotion C: boredom D: impatience E: pressure<n>Answer: B: promotion<n><n>Input: He was good at traditional science but excelled at social science, his favorite subject was what? Choices:  A: geography B: history studies C: math D: religion E: dancing<n>Answer: B: history studies<n><n>### Input:James drove his niece to her father.  Where did he drive? Choices:  A: great granddad's house B: family picture book C: brother's house D: family tree E: family reunion<n><n>### Response:		Answer choices A and B<n><n>### Instructions:<n>You now have two options for completing the request.<n><n>Option 1:<n>1. Use a sentence containing a transitive verb with the direct object in bold<n>2. Use the preposition ‘to’ in the verb phrase<n>3. Use an appositive (a noun or pronoun between commas that appears near a noun to express a description) for the relative pronoun ‘who/whom’<n><n><n>### Option 2<n><n>1. Use the indefinite article ‘a’ with a gerund (a verb without subject which ends in ‘ing’<n>2. Use a preposition ‘at’<n><n>>### Incorrect Answers:<n>Option 1: You are incorrect about option 1<n><n>Option 2: You are incorrect about both options 2 or 3<n>

Choices:  A: geography B: history studies C: math D: religion E: dancing<n>Answer: B: history studies<n><n>### Input:Where do  you park in the parking lot with shopping bags? What does the man mean when he says, “I hate this assignment.”? Choices:  “I hate the task.” “I don’t prefer this activity at all.” “I don’thate my job.” “I don’treally like my supervisor.” “<n>I think this assignment is boring.” “I can't get this completed quickly.”<n><n>### Response. The most likely reason for him giving this opinion is that he can’t:<n><n>A: understand how to explain his opinion.<n><n>B: think of a way to explain his opinion. C: write a response about his opinion.<n><n>### Input : What is the most likely reason the man gave for why he will use the app? Choices: I: get it quickly. “I plan to do some grocery shopping this weekend. I’ll use the app to get the items quickly.<n><n>```<n>I’ll probably buy them locally. <n>```<n><n>II: check my account. “I’ll check my account balance. I want to ensure I have enough money for<n><n>```<n>my expenses. “<n><n>III: contact my bank. “I know I have a great deal on my loan. I want to compare my rate to that of the average person.<n> <n>```<n>IV: learn about rates. “I want to learn more about rates and fees. I want to know what other customers are paying so I can negotiate a better deal.<n>```<n><n>V: learn about benefits. “I want to know more about how to access my credit. I want to learn how to apply for a credit card. I want to learn about the benefits of<n><n>```<n>my credit card.”<n>```<n><n>### Response<n>I choose C. <n><n>### Input<n>What does the man mean when refers to being "confused?” Choices: I: He is concerned about the assignment.<n><n>```<n>II: He is concerned about being late.<n>```<n><n>III: He is trying to sound polite.<n><n>```<n>IV: He is unsure of how to complete the request.<n>```<n><n>## What is a likely reason the man was "confused?" Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: He fantasied about getting a what while driving to work and the pros and cons of the extra responsibilities and benefits? Choices:  A: new car B: promotion C: boredom D: impatience E: pressure<n>Answer: B: promotion<n><n>Input: He was good at traditional science but excelled at social science, his favorite subject was what? Choices:  A: geography B: history studies C: math D: religion E: dancing<n>Answer: B: history studies<n><n>### Input:His day at the office was nearing an end, he went to the start menu on his computer to do what? Choices:  A: run programs B: play games C: control model D: power down E: reason exists<n><n>### Response:		Answer the question in complete sentences, using proper capitalization, punctuation and spelling.<n><n>He fantasied about getting an new car while driving to work and thought about the pros and cons of getting a new car would bring. He had a good job, so money wasn't a problem, but he realized he would have to spend less time on hobbies and friends because he had less time on his hands with the extra responsibilities of a car payment. On the plus side, he would save money on lunch at the local deli, and enjoyment is increased, and he realized he could pick his own friends as he would be less constrained by public transportation. He was good at traditional sciences, He excelled at social sciences and history was his favorite subject, although he liked math too. On the weekend, he enjoyed dancing the cha-cha.<n><n>### Assessment:<n>* I am doing well.<n>* If this were a real assessment, my score would put me at the 96%.<n>* I did really bad.<n>* I am pretty sure I would get fired if this were a real assessement, I would be in the 30%

Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: He fantasied about getting a what while driving to work and the pros and cons of the extra responsibilities and benefits? Choices:  A: new car B: promotion C: boredom D: impatience E: pressure<n>Answer: B: promotion<n><n>Input: He was good at traditional science but excelled at social science, his favorite subject was what? Choices:  A: geography B: history studies C: math D: religion E: dancing<n>Answer: B: history studies<n><n>### Input:The human looked down longingly as he sat in the orbiting space station, what did he miss? Choices:  A: nearest house B: workplace C: surface of earth D: office block E: his feet<n><n>### Response:		A: nearest house<n><n>### Question:You have an appointment at 3:50, which will require a drive of about 29 minutes. You hope to be there in 10 minutes or less. How much time would that leave after you parked? Choices:  <u>A:</u> 15 minutes <u>B:</u> 2 minutes <u>C:</u> 49 minutes <u>D:</u> 39 minutes <u>E:</u> 50 minutes<n><n>### Responses<n><n>1) 29 × 4/5 ≈ 15.7 Minutes = 15<n>2) 28 ÷ (4×4/5) ≈ 50 or 49 mins<n>3) 28/4×4/5=59 mins or 39min<n>4) 28÷(4×4/5)+1 =73 mins or 3 mins less than 76 mins<n>5) 28÷4+4/5=29 mins or 1 min less than 30 mins<n><n>193+4:15<n><n>### Input<n>The problem was solved by creating and then applying the equation<n><n>29 mins * (4*4/5) - 4/5 = 15 mins<n><n>### Discussion:<n><n>What could be done differently to solve this problem.<n><n>### Question<n>I don’t understand why my answer was not correct<n><n>### Task:<n>1. Review your attempt<n>2. Identify what was missing?<n>3. Describe a new approach you could use.<n>4. Provide a screenshot of your attempt.<n><n>### References

For example, a list item: Prompt: I would like a cup of what? would correspond to a user choice to drink a cup of tea.<n><n>- [ ] You will create a file with all responses listed in the prompt, e.g.<n>```<n>"I'd like a green one and a blue one, please."<n>```<n><n>- [ ] All tasks are read from a file called "task.txt" stored in the "task" folder.<n>  <n>- [ ] You save all responses as taskResponse.txt file in the task folder<n><n>### Output:<n><n><img alt="Output" src="src/taskResponse.txt" /><n><n>    A green apple and another blue one, thank you<n><n><img alt"Output" src="srctaskResponse.txt" ><n><img alt"Response" src="taskResponse.txt" width="700"><n><n>### Bonus: If you can develop the program, you can develop an output that looks like the following:<n><img alt "Output" src="task_0.png" width="70%"><n><img alt "output" src="task2_0.png" ><n><img height="30%"," width="30%" alt "Output" src= "task3_0.png" src="task4_0.png"  style="width:600px;"><n><img alt "task_0" src="task3_0.jpeg" width="auto"><n><n>### Note: <n>- [x] <n>- [ ]<n>- [ ] <n>- [ ]

Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: He fantasied about getting a what while driving to work and the pros and cons of the extra responsibilities and benefits? Choices:  A: new car B: promotion C: boredom D: impatience E: pressure<n>Answer: B: promotion<n><n>Input: He was good at traditional science but excelled at social science, his favorite subject was what? Choices:  A: geography B: history studies C: math D: religion E: dancing<n>Answer: B: history studies<n><n>### Input:Where could you find a laundry room that is only used by staff? Choices:  A: house B: hotel C: green house D: college E: dorm<n><n>### Response:		<n>The correct answer should be C: green house.<n><n>### Input<n>You must include at least one of the following terms/phrases.<n>1.<n>2.<n>### Instruction<n>The following phrases could have been used to fill the blank in the instruction. This question gives four correct options (which, those, these, etc..). Use a phrase from the four options in your answer.<n><n>1. What, those, these, those<n>2. those, those, these<n><n>### Instructions:<n>The phrase found in the instruction (those) was an example of:<n>1) subject pronoun<n>2) direct object<n>3) appositive<n>4) adverb<n>5) prepositional phrase<n><n>### Choice 1:<n>The phrase _those_ was most likely the subject pronoun. A pronoun _substitutes_ for a noun, such as the word _they_ in the sentence "He is the one who did it."<n><n>### Choices 2 through 5:<n>The phrase those also functions as a direct object. A direct object takes the action of a verb in the sentence. For example, the sentence "She made me cry" has the word _me_ as the direct object of the verb _make_.<n><n>The word _those_ also acts as an appositive, which is a word, phrase, or clause (a group of words) which provides descriptive or identifying information about another word, phrase, or sentence in the same clause or sentence. In this case, the word _those_ functioned as an appositive that explained the subject _them_. The sentence "His father bought them (the _them_ acting as appositive to _those)_ a car for their 18th birthday."<n><n>The word _they_ also functions as an adverb, which is a word or phrase that expresses a relation of time, place, or circumstance. For example, the word _they_ acts as an adverb in the sentence "Tom is taller _than_ the rest of his siblings."<n><n>The phrase " _those_ who were there" also functions as a prepositional phrase, which is a combination of a preposition, its object, and any objects of the object. For example, the phrase "to his left, _behind_ the

Choices:  A: geography B: history studies C: math D: religion E: dancing<n>Answer: B: history studies<n><n>### Input:When you experience boredom, what can you do on television? Choices:  A: watch film B: play cards C: play chess D: read news papers E: surf net<n><n>### Response:		<n>-A: watch film - B: play cards - C: play chess - D: read news papers - E: surf net <n><n>### Instructions:<n><n>Write instructions that respond to the prompt.<n><n>### For information see:<n>[Wikipedia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Humor_in_computer_science)
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: He fantasied about getting a what while driving to work and the pros and cons of the extra responsibilities and benefits? Choices:  A: new car B: promotion C: boredom D: impatience E: pressure<n>Answer: B: promotion<n><n>Input: He was good at traditional science but excelled at social science, his favorite subject was what? Choices:  A: geography B: history studies C: math D: religion E: dancing<n>Answer: B: history studies<n><n>### Input:What place would a person go to look at zebras? Choices:  A: zoo B: museum C: hospital D: desk E: opera<n><n>### Response:		What a strange answer. I'll go with place A<n><n>### Input:[a random number from a generator is assigned to an object in a list. A list is emptied when its length is negative. The generator is started again. What is the output?]<n><n>### Response : A list of -1<n><n>### Explanation : List is empty<n><n>### Input : [ a list is empty]<n><n>### Expected Output : [1,2,3]<n><n>### Input[ a number]<n><n>### Answer: 12<n><n>```<n>from typing import List<n><n><n>def solution(number: int) -> List:<n>    number -= 1<n>    list = []<n>    while number > 0:<n>        list.append(number)<n>        number -= 1<n><n>    return list<n><n><n># Test a function<n>for i in range 3:<n>    print(solution(i))<n>```<n>

Choices:  A: geography B: history studies C: math D: religion E: dancing<n>Answer: B: history studies<n><n>### Input:The fact the two sides were able to even reach tentative agreement was a feat to what? Choices:  A: accomplish B: make progress C: stop arguing D: do business E: concert<n><n>### Response:		A<n><n>### Explanation:<n>He fantasied about getting what while driving to work<n><n>### Expected Output:<n><n>### What did he fantasize?<n><n>### Your task:<n>Write a response that appropriately answers the question.<n><n>## Submission instructions<n>You may want to print this page for reference. Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: He fantasied about getting a what while driving to work and the pros and cons of the extra responsibilities and benefits? Choices:  A: new car B: promotion C: boredom D: impatience E: pressure<n>Answer: B: promotion<n><n>Input: He was good at traditional science but excelled at social science, his favorite subject was what? Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: He fantasied about getting a what while driving to work and the pros and cons of the extra responsibilities and benefits? Choices:  A: new car B: promotion C: boredom D: impatience E: pressure<n>Answer: B: promotion<n><n>Input: He was good at traditional science but excelled at social science, his favorite subject was what? Choices:  A: geography B: history studies C: math D: religion E: dancing<n>Answer: B: history studies<n><n>### Input:Where are small grapes used? Choices:  A: picnic basket B: wine press C: juice D: fruit cocktail E: kitchen<n><n>### Response:		 All Of The Above<n><n><n>### Instructions: <n>1. Enter the program in notepad<n>2. Test the program using the instruction file from the file folder<n><n>### Instance Description:<n>1. Write a program that asks the user to name an item and then asks the user if they are ready.<n><n>### Challenge:<n>Write an if/else statement to ask the user to confirm they are ready for the next prompt. <n><n>### Instinct:<n>If the boolean statement the user' will choose "are you ready" = TRUE then do the else portion of the code. <n><n>## Expected Result: <n>user to be presented the prompt that they must select from choices one of "NO" or "YES"<n><n>## Coding: <n><n>```cpp<n>	#include <iostream><n>	using namespace std;<n>	int xvalue = 0;<n><n>	int main()<n>		{ <n>		char answer;<n>		cout <<"Please enter a number between 1-15: ";<n>		cin >> answer;<n><n>		if (xvalue == 1) {<n>			cout << "Choice 1: ";<n>		}<n>		else if (xvalue == 2) {<n>		cout << "You need to do more.";<n>			for (;;)<n>			{<n>				cout << "\nDo you need to learn more information for this question:" << endl<n>			<< "Type 'n' Yes, 'N' No"<n>			<< "\nYour response must be case-sensitive.";<n>		cout<n>		<< "Answer: ";<n>			cin >> response ;<n><n>		if(response == "N" )<n>		{<n>	break;<n>	<n>	}<n>			else if (response == "n" || response == "N")<n>			{ return 1;<n>			}<n>	}<n>	}	<n><n>	return 0; <n><n><n>```<n>

Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: He fantasied about getting a what while driving to work and the pros and cons of the extra responsibilities and benefits? Choices:  A: new car B: promotion C: boredom D: impatience E: pressure<n>Answer: B: promotion<n><n>Input: He was good at traditional science but excelled at social science, his favorite subject was what? Choices:  A: geography B: history studies C: math D: religion E: dancing<n>Answer: B: history studies<n><n>### Input:What kind of driving leads to accidents? Choices:  A: stressful B: dangerous C: fun D: illegal E: deadly<n><n>### Response:		<n>In 2009, there were over three million car accidents according to the United States Department of Transportation as per [this](https://www.cdc.gov/motorvehiclesafety/index.html) website. The majority of these accidents are the result of distracted driving. Distracted driving leads to accidents because you are not fully focused on the task of driving. Distracted Driving includes eating, drinking, texting, or any other activities that require your attention. The United States Department of Transportations says that in 2008, the National Highway Transportation Safety Administration estimated that distracted driving was the cause of 6 percent of all road traffic accidents, and that this figure was even higher in rural areas. In conclusion, the majority of the driving accidents result from distracted driving which it is defined as driver inattention.<n>

Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: He fantasied about getting a what while driving to work and the pros and cons of the extra responsibilities and benefits? Choices:  A: new car B: promotion C: boredom D: impatience E: pressure<n>Answer: B: promotion<n><n>Input: He was good at traditional science but excelled at social science, his favorite subject was what? Choices:  A: geography B: history studies C: math D: religion E: dancing<n>Answer: B: history studies<n><n>### Input:The teacher told all the students that listening was key, it was the main way they would gain what? Choices:  A: empathy B: anxiety C: knowlege D: falling down E: hear things<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>I have two responsibilities when I am working at the store. First of all, I should provide excellent customer service. The second responsibility is that I should always maintain customer retention.<n><n>### Comments:<n><n>The instructions above have been simplified. They were actually:<n>```<n>  You're thinking about a job.<n>  You've thought of several potential disadvantages.<n>  The most significant is:<n>    (A) that you'll be working from home<n>    In addition, a job will mean that:<n>    a. Your free time will become more limited<n>    b. You'll have to deal with a lot more stress<n><n>You're considering taking up a new hobby.<n>To put it another way:<n>You're good at:<n>1. traditional science<n>2. social science<n><n>In social science, you excelled at:<n>1. geography<n>2. history studies<n>3. math<n>4. religion<n><n>You're also good at<n>A: geography<n>B: history studies<n>C: math<n>D: religion<n>E: dancing<n><n>```<n>*Note!*<n><n>### Code<n>```<n>    "He fantasied about getting what while driving to work?"<n>           $input.add("Getting a $choicePrompt");<n>    "The pros and cons of the responsibilities and benefits"<n>           $input.join()<n><n>    "The teacher told all the student that listening was key"<n>            $input.add(" It was the main way to gain")<n><n>    "what is the main way to know all"<n><n>    # Choices<n><n>    "empathy"<n>           $Input.add("empathy");<n>    "anxiety"<n>           $InputChoices.add("anxiety");<n>    "knowledge"<n>           $InputInChoices.add("knowledge");<n><n>    "falling down"<n>           $InputInputChoices.add("<Falling>");<n>    "hear things"<n>           $InputHearThings.add("hear things");<n><n>```<n>

(their question "You might")<n>*(their first input) If you did well on your last test.* (their first input), you might get an A *(their second and third input "and")* (their last input "as...") an A *(the second and third input)*.<n>*Awesome!* you did well on your previous tests! Below is an instruction that describes a task. Choice B may be an appropriate response but it is usually not stated by the person in front of the crowd. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: He fantasied about getting a what while driving to work and the pros and cons of the extra responsibilities and benefits? Choices:  A: new car B: promotion C: boredom D: impatience E: pressure<n>Answer: B: promotion<n><n>Input: He was good at traditional science but excelled at social science, his favorite subject was what? Choices:  A: geography B: history studies C: math D: religion E: dancing<n>Answer: B: history studies<n><n>### Input:Where would a Martian find the Indian Ocean? Choices:  A: asia B: southern hemisphere C: planet D: east E: earth<n><n>### Response:		<n><n><code>var answer = [prompt(" Input: He fantasied to get a what"),"b,"promotion",prompt(" Input: he was good at traditional science,but excelled at social science")?"A","B","history", prompt("Input: Where would a Martian find th Indian Ocean,")?[ prompt("A:Asia","False"), prompt("B:Southenr hemisfere","False"), prompt("C: Plant","False"),prompt("D: East","False"),prompt( "E: Earth","True") ]]<n><n>output: ["B": promotion","B": history"]<n><n># output: ["true","false"]<n>### Instruction : Write a function that takes the number 316 and changes it into any other number.<n>### Demo:<n>### Input: 316<n>Output: 163<n><n><n>### Input:"56089628"<n>Output: "517151"<n><n>function changeNumber(num){<n>var result = num,<n>int = parseInt(result),<n>string = parseInt(result);<n><n>output: parseInt(string)<n>}<n><n>### Input : Output an appropriate response.<n>What did you do after school?<n><n>### Input 2: Output the corresponding response.<n>What's your favorite music band?<n><n>```<n>1.<n>B: a<n>```
