Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: He fantasied about getting a what while driving to work and the pros and cons of the extra responsibilities and benefits? Choices:  A: new car B: promotion C: boredom D: impatience E: pressure<n>Answer: B: promotion<n><n>Input: He was good at traditional science but excelled at social science, his favorite subject was what? Choices:  A: geography B: history studies C: math D: religion E: dancing<n>Answer: B: history studies<n><n>### Input:Where would you get a bass clarinet to take home? Choices:  A: orchestra B: school band C: music store D: opera house E: home<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>```bash<n>echo "A"<n>```<n>or<n>```bash<n>echo -e "A\n"`<n><n><n>### Input :<n>Input: What is the longest bone in the human body? Choices: 	A: spine B: jaw C: skull D: rib E : clavicle<n> <n>### Response: <n>```bash<n>echo 'E'`<n><n>```<n><n>### Input <n>Input: I have no ____ to be a successful student. Choices:  A baseball fan B: musical instrument C: hobby D:  friend E: book collection<n> <n>### Respone:<n>```bash<n>echo E<n>```<n>### or<n>```<n>echo -e "E"<n>```<n><n>##  Example :<n>  **Following is an example in which you write a program that asks for numbers<n>from a user until the user types ‘done’. Use the `read` function (see<n>[README](../README.md) for more on that.)<n><n>```bash<n>#!/bin/bash<n>echo "Enter as many numbers as you would like:"<n>read numbers<n>echo "Your numbers are:"<n>for numbers in $(seq 1 $numbers)<n>do<n>	echo "$numbers"<n>done<n>```<n><n>## Contributing<n><n>Pull request are welcome!<n><n>## Thanks<n><n>Special thanks to :<n>- [Mike Branton](https://www.mikebranton.com/);<n>- [Derek Wang](https://github.com/derekjwang)<n><n>- [Vinay Tiwari](https://github.github.com/vinay) ; <n>- [Zhuo](https://github.io/Zhuo); <n>- [Tina Yuan](https://github.gg/TinaYuan); <n>- [Ivan Lee](https://github.co/IvanLee007) ; <n>- and of course [you](https://github.dev/user)!<n><n>The code is [MIT licensed](LICENSE).<n><n><n><n>If you have found a bug please [open an issue](https://github.report/jacques)<n><n>Have fun!<n>

Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: He fantasied about getting a what while driving to work and the pros and cons of the extra responsibilities and benefits? Choices:  A: new car B: promotion C: boredom D: impatience E: pressure<n>Answer: B: promotion<n><n>Input: He was good at traditional science but excelled at social science, his favorite subject was what? Choices:  A: geography B: history studies C: math D: religion E: dancing<n>Answer: B: history studies<n><n>### Input:What is made out of only one piece? Choices:  A: jigsaw puzzle B: chess game C: puzzle box D: jigsaw puzzel puxxle E: puxxle<n><n>### Response:		The answer is a jigsaw puzzle<n><n>### If all choices were A except E, the answer is that it would be a jigsaw puzzel. This is the only case where only one letter is different between choice A and choice notA.<n><n>### An example of when an answer might be only one letter different between choices A and notA.<n><n>The second piece is the hardest of all parts to place because it has the fewest possible places where it can be located.<n><n>The first and third pieces can be placed any of four-ways. The 2048 game is a combination of two different games: sliding puzzles and the 1024 game.<n><n>### The 2042 game requires two pieces to be in place to form the 444, so it might be a good choice for your game.<n><n>## Input:The 1051 game is a challenging game because it is impossible to win.<n><n>Input:The number of different ways one can play 4x4 is 68.<n><n>Input: If I am working on a board of the 444 game on day 159 and the 2048 day 281, my chances of winning the 2028 game on that day are 1 in? Choices: 14866142 A: 1.5 B: 63552 25<n><n>Answer: C: 52103.<n><n>**Explanation**<n><n>**Example**<n><n>**Science of Sleep**<n><n>**Exercise:**<n><n>### Task: Answer the following multiple-choice question.<n><n>## Demonstration: Input: He was good at mathematics. He struggled with science and history, his strengths were languages.<n><n>An interesting fact about mathematics is that it can be used to describe and study reality.<n><n>He had a hard time in calculus because he had always been good in geometry and algebra, but he couldn’t keep up his grades.<n><n>In math, there are formulas that can be used to describe the behavior of many things in life, and they are easy-to-use in a variety of applications.<n><n>### Task answer:Answer: 8<n><n>## Demonstração:<n>Input: He

Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: He fantasied about getting a what while driving to work and the pros and cons of the extra responsibilities and benefits? Choices:  A: new car B: promotion C: boredom D: impatience E: pressure<n>Answer: B: promotion<n><n>Input: He was good at traditional science but excelled at social science, his favorite subject was what? Choices:  A: geography B: history studies C: math D: religion E: dancing<n>Answer: B: history studies<n><n>### Input:What is love when everyone keeps feeling it? Choices:  A: contagious B: wrong C: last forever D: painful E: blind<n><n>### Response:		<n>#### [0,100]<n><n>```python<n>import csv<n>import json<n>import os<n>```<n><n>```python<n>def getSentence(choice):<n>    return "Love {}.".format(choice)<n><n>with open('instructions.csv', mode='r') as f:<n>    reader = csv.reader(f)<n>    for row in reader:<n>        words = [word.split(':')[1] for word in row]<n>        words = words[:2]<n>        if words == ['A', 'promotion']: <n>            print(getSentence('B'), getSentence('C','', False),<n>                  getSentence('D', 'the boss', True),<n>                  getLine('E', '', True))<n>        if words[:2] == ['B','social']: <n>            return<n>        print(getSentences('D', words[1]))<n><n>def getSentences(question, answer, space, capital): <n>    print "{}{ }".format(getLine(space, capital), getLine(space, False))<n>    print getSentence(capital)<n>```<n><n><n>  The program is now ready to run and can be started from the command line with: `python test.py`.<n><n>```python<n>Sentences = [['a', 'C', 'the boss'],<n>              ['A', 'C', 'blind'], <n>              ['C', 'D', 'the bull'],<n>              ['D', 'E', 'a flower'],<n>              ['C', '', 'the car']]<n><n>questions = ['What did he fantasize about getting as he drove off to work', 'How many people get promoted', 'What is love', 'What is a flower', 'When does he wake up']<n>values = ['a promotion', 'fewer', 'painful']<n>answers = ['a gift', 'dream', 'last', 'forver', 'now']<n>answers = [answer for question in questions if answer in answers]<n><n>test=1<n>line=(400 if test == 1 else 310)<n><n>for choice in choice_strings:<n>    if choice == 'b': questions.pop()<n><n>    if choice == "a": <n>

Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: He fantasied about getting a what while driving to work and the pros and cons of the extra responsibilities and benefits? Choices:  A: new car B: promotion C: boredom D: impatience E: pressure<n>Answer: B: promotion<n><n>Input: He was good at traditional science but excelled at social science, his favorite subject was what? Choices:  A: geography B: history studies C: math D: religion E: dancing<n>Answer: B: history studies<n><n>### Input:Where are you if your reading magazines while waiting for a vehicle on rails? Choices:  A: vegetables B: market C: doctor D: train station E: bookstore<n><n>### Response:		<n>```python<n>def my_answer(word, choices):<n>    # Write your code here.<n>    if choices == "A":<n>        choices = "A"<n>    elif choices == "B":<n>        choices = 'B'<n>    elif choices == 'C':<n>        choices = 'E'<n>    elif choices== "D":<n>        choices='D'<n>    elif choices=="E":<n>        choices='E'<n>    # Write the word you are looking for here<n>    return choices<n><n>my_input = "A"<n>print("word", my_answer(my_input, str(my_input)))<n>```<n><n>### Output Expectation<n>- The word is "C" so it outputs "C"

I like coffee, but I don't like coffee very much.<n>```<n><n>Coffee can't dislike coffee, just as 2.<n><n>```<n>2.  I like music, and I don't dislike music.<n>```<n><n><n>

Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: He fantasied about getting a what while driving to work and the pros and cons of the extra responsibilities and benefits? Choices:  A: new car B: promotion C: boredom D: impatience E: pressure<n>Answer: B: promotion<n><n>Input: He was good at traditional science but excelled at social science, his favorite subject was what? Choices:  A: geography B: history studies C: math D: religion E: dancing<n>Answer: B: history studies<n><n>### Input:If someone is outgoing what are they likely to seek? Choices:  A: new experiences B: playfulness C: own house D: good looking E: beautiful<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>Outgoing is likely an adjective that refers to someone who is extroverted.<n><n>One may seek new experiences because they gain a sense of adventure when they explore a new area or do something unexpectedly different.<n><n>Someone who is extrovert could use being extroverted to fulfill those needs.<n><n>Outgoing is not likely an adjective that applies to someone who is introverted.

Other metals, with the exception of gold and silver, rarely occur freely in nature.<n><n>Gold is found in quartz, rocks and alluvial gravels in riverbeds.<n><n>### Output:<n>Precious metals are rare in nature and have been used to create jewelry. Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: He fantasied about getting a what while driving to work and the pros and cons of the extra responsibilities and benefits? Choices:  A: new car B: promotion C: boredom D: impatience E: pressure<n>Answer: B: promotion<n><n>Input: He was good at traditional science but excelled at social science, his favorite subject was what? Choices:  A: geography B: history studies C: math D: religion E: dancing<n>Answer: B: history studies<n><n>### Input:People always talked childlike to him, even though his disability was physical and didn't affect his what? Choices:  A: strength B: brain C: potential D: qualification E: competence<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>### A. He fantasied about gotting a new car while driving to work and then he asked his mother to check a dictionary of words to find the meaning of car. The words is "something for carrying people or things". On the road, you sit inside you car and drive. So the car can be a transportation. Then he continued thinking about the benefits from the transportation car. If you don't having a car for transportation, you should walking. Walking is good to your health but bad if you driving to work for 4 hours every day. And for driving the car is very tired. When the time comes to buy a new car, he was a little bit confused because there are dozens of different models. Every model has its own advantages and disadvantages. So he chose the car which have a lot models. He can choose to change cars in a new model every few years. His new job and higher job is a promotion which is he's a leader of group of people. The leader of the group has a greater chance to improve personal ability because they will train you. However, it brings a lot of extra responsibilities which he must care for everyone in this group. He can not sit inside the office every day. Sometimes he have to move outside. When he move outside, he will not be inside. So he should not let the car park because if not pay the parking fee. And if he keep his car outside, it will be stolen. He should park inside the garage and let someone to take care it when he not there. When he choose the benefit option, he should use to buy the car as a transportation tool. He should have a promotion too. A promotion brings a lot of chance for him.

Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: He fantasied about getting a what while driving to work and the pros and cons of the extra responsibilities and benefits? Choices:  A: new car B: promotion C: boredom D: impatience E: pressure<n>Answer: B: promotion<n><n>Input: He was good at traditional science but excelled at social science, his favorite subject was what? Choices:  A: geography B: history studies C: math D: religion E: dancing<n>Answer: B: history studies<n><n>### Input:She was processing the wool, she kept her leg bouncing to operate the what? Choices:  A: hospital bed B: legroom C: spinning wheel D: grand piano E: rhythm<n><n>### Response:		A: spinning wheel<n><n>**Explanation**: The answer is in the instruction. <n><n>**Notice**: The first answer has just been answered<n><n>```javascript<n>var choices = ["new car", "promotion", "boredom", "impatience", "pressure"];<n>var correct_answer = "promotion";<n>var user_answer;<n>var correct_answer_index = -1;<n><n>while (user_answer === undefined)<n>{<n>    var input_word = prompt("Enter an answer in lowercase");<n>    var correct_answer_index_found = choices.findIndex(function(obj)<n>    {<n>        return obj === correct_answer;<n>    });<n>    if (correct_answer_index_match > -1 &&<n>        input_answer === correct_answer)<n>    {<n>       if (correct_answer === choices[0])<n>        {<n>            console.log("A: "+ input_word);<n>        }<n>        else if (correct_answer == choices[1])<n>        {<n>        correct_answer_index++;<n>        console.log("B: "+ input_word.toUpperCase());<n>        }<n>        console.log(choices[correct_answer_index]);<n>        return;<n>    }<n>    if (correct.answer_index === undefined)<n>    {<n>    console.log("Error: Please choose one from the following.");<n>    choices.push(choices[correct.answer_index + 1]);<n>    return false;<n>    }<n>}<n>```
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: He fantasied about getting a what while driving to work and the pros and cons of the extra responsibilities and benefits? Choices:  A: new car B: promotion C: boredom D: impatience E: pressure<n>Answer: B: promotion<n><n>Input: He was good at traditional science but excelled at social science, his favorite subject was what? Choices:  A: geography B: history studies C: math D: religion E: dancing<n>Answer: B: history studies<n><n>### Input:The boy was too nervous to dance, so what was he doing progressively at the ball? Choices:  A: dance like crazy B: standing still C: wallflower D: stand still E: like dancing<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>I didn't have much opportunity for physical activities growing up so I was the classic example of the "wall-flower". I was a shy guy in my early youth but I grew out of that being put into the military, which by default forced me to adapt or remain dormant. In my spare time I like to take advantage of the sports and recreation facilities on our base. I enjoy working out, dancing is for extroverts only! I haven't had a dance partner in a decade, not even for the occasional wedding.<n><n>### Challenge<n><n>We will challenge you to use the answers as inspiration as it will force you to use your creativity. Can you tell us a compelling story using these facts and your own unique experience?<n><n>### Checker:<n>A checker can check that your story is well-written, accurate, and coherent within the constraints of the input. They might give you additional information about the request. If the input wasn't clear, they may help you to rephrase the question to improve the quality of the output. If the request was ambiguous or vague, they may ask additional open-ended questions to clarify and refine the request.<n><n># What is a checker?<n><n>Checkers serve a dual purpose:<n>* Check a response for accuracy<n>* Assist you to improve your writing<n><n># How can this process be improved?<n><n>The steps are:<n><n>1. Ask the expert (write your email)<n>2. Receive the response (answer the email)<n>3. Checker (respond to the response as a checker) (complete instructions to respond as a checker)<n>

Please ensure your response is a single word.<n><n>### The question is a statement.<n>Please select which of the four answef's best describes how you feel abpout the statement.<n><n>- *It's time to eat dinner *<n>- *I am feeling angry and sad.*<n>- *I am happy to be home.*<n>- I am really looking forward to dinner.*<n><n>### Additional Information:<n><pre><b>How you're feeling</pre></b><n><n>### Demos:<n><n>### Instuction:Given all possible questions. What is the maximum number of questions answered?<n>There will be several questions. For questions, the answer set is limited with the given answer keys. You will evaluate the following questions in which each question has three answer keys available.<n>Question 1 - Answers will be marked:<n>1. A - Yes<n>2. B - No<n><n>Question 2 - Answers will be picked from the following:<n>1. A1 - Yes<n>2. A2 - Yes<n>3. A3 - No<n>4. B1 - Yes<n>5. B2 - No<n>6. B3 - Yes<n><n>Question 3 - Answers will be selected between the following:<n>1 - A<n>2 - B<n>3 - C<n><n>Given:<n>> 1. Answers of Question 1 has 2 answer keys that are marked "Yes"<n>> 2. Answers of Question will be selected between A and B<n>> 3. Answers on Question 3 will be selected between A, B and C<n><n>### Input<n><n>`Question Number: Question 1<n><n>`Yes<n><n>[A1] - Question 2<n><n>`Yes<n>[B1] - Question 3<n><n>`Yes<n>`<n><n>### Response<n><n>The maximum number of yes are answered.<n>

Choices:  A: new car B: promotion C: boredom D: impatience E: pressure<n>Answer: B: promotion<n><n>Input: He was good at traditional science but excelled at social science, his favorite subject was what? Choices:  A: geography B: history studies C: math D: religion E: dancing<n>Answer: B: history studies<n><n>### Input:As a human in a large northeastern city, where can you see animals? Choices:  A: zoo B: workplace C: sky D: new york city E: many places<n><n>### Response:		<n>> He was good at traditional and excelled in social sciences for years. His favorite subject has been history studies. I am a human residing in the northeastern part of New York City where I can see a variety of different species in zoos.<n><n>### Explanation:<n>- This instruction is about an existing data that is not in our form and hence we should respond with one sentence and appropriate verbs.<n>- In the initial instruction, we can deduce that the writer is a human living somewhere in a northeastern city.<n>- This means the northeastern city can be a zoo.<n>- The writer uses "where" at the end to tell you where you can find these animals.<n>- We can find these animals at an existing zoo in the northeastern city.<n><n>### Bonus Points:<n><n>### What were you doing?<n><n>> I was studying on my bed.<n><n>### What does the data tell us?<n><n>> It tells us that a human can find and use data in different circumstances. The data will help humans to find solutions for their purposes.<n>><n>> <pre> The data in this example is the instruction above.<n>>		</pre><n><n>### Write a sentence using the words the instruction provided.<n><n>> It tells 	 me to use an open question format. Choices:  A: geography B: history studies C: math D: religion E: dancing<n>Answer: B: history studies<n><n>### Input:The drug kingpin told his man to run errands, this was code to go to all the dealers to do what they had? Choices:  A: park B: make time for C: receive instructions D: take money E: leave work<n><n>### Response:		The first and second questions are not related to a scenario in the lesson, The third question was the drug kingpin telling his man to go out and do drug deals across the city. His man was now an errand boy he had to take money to drug dealers. We can expect the errand boy to do what next?<n>Answer: The errand boy will make his way to the park and carry out the drug deal in the park.<n><n>### Question:<n>What is the role of a program in a computer?<n>Answer: It is a process or program in a computer a computer performs different task on executing a program<n>### Question: <n> What is an interpreter?<n>Answer: A program that translate the high level program into machine code. <n>### Question: What does a compiler do<n>The compiler take the high level language and it translates it into a low level language<n><n>### Question<n>Why the compiler does this.<n><n>This is important because a high level language that is written on the computer can be easily accessed by anyone in the world therefore not encrypted. A compiler however is only accessible for a program as it converts the high level language to the machine language which is meant for the computer.<n><n>### Additonal Instruction:<n>Input: The program should be on how ____ and should be created and published before you can access it. Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: He fantasied about getting a what while driving to work and the pros and cons of the extra responsibilities and benefits? Choices:  A: new car B: promotion C: boredom D: impatience E: pressure<n>Answer: B: promotion<n><n>Input: He was good at traditional science but excelled at social science, his favorite subject was what? Choices:  A: geography B: history studies C: math D: religion E: dancing<n>Answer: B: history studies<n><n>### Input:What do drugs do? Choices:  A: damage B: cloud mind C: lower i.q D: cause illness E: cause accidents<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>**The use of drugs damages or clouds the user's mind**.<n><n><n>### Rationale:<n>The first input "He fantasied about getting..." is a declarative sentence which makes use of the pronoun _he_, this pronoun has already been defined as belonging to the subject of the sentence, as the sentence follows the word "about" the sentence has already established the person performing the action is "He" and a proper noun "fantasied" and a _gerund_ the answer cannot be "gerund_ as they does not occur to form part of the answer, option "A" and option "C" are both nouns neither are pronouns so are ineligible for the answer, the remaining options are a verb which is not found in the sentence so option "E" is incorrect, only option "B" is compatible with the input sentence and is therefore logical.<n><n>Option "B" is a noun and is in agreement with the subject in the sentence i.e. "He", the answer is therefore found in the option list, the verbal phrase "about getting" can be seen to be a _predicate_ and "a what..." part of the sentence can be seen to be the _object_ of the predicate "about", the subject of the sentence is performing an activity of "getting a what..." and therefore the phrase "a what..." provides extra details to the sentence so that it is possible to understand the sentence and as any other adjective the adjectival phrase "a new car..." also belongs to the class of words that describe "a what..." <n>

Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: He fantasied about getting a what while driving to work and the pros and cons of the extra responsibilities and benefits? Choices:  A: new car B: promotion C: boredom D: impatience E: pressure<n>Answer: B: promotion<n><n>Input: He was good at traditional science but excelled at social science, his favorite subject was what? Choices:  A: geography B: history studies C: math D: religion E: dancing<n>Answer: B: history studies<n><n>### Input:If you want to make a big splash in a river with a rock, from where should you throw it? Choices:  A: mountains countryside B: ground C: bridge D: mountain range E: surface of earth<n><n>### Response:		<n>### Instruction :<n>> If you want to make a huge splash in a river, make sure to do so at the bottom.<n><n>### Note : <n>> This is a multiple-choice question.<n><n>## 3<n>####Instruction: Write a program that makes a splash, with or without the use of recursion.<n><n>```python<n>class Splash(object):<n>		def main(self,location,item):<n>			if location == "ground" or location == "mountain":<n>					# Do nothing and return<n>			elif location == "bridge" or location == "surface of earth" or location == "ground" :<n>				# Make a splash. Return<n>			else :<n>			    self.get_message(item)<n>			return<n>		def get_message(self,location):<n>			self.main(location,location)<n>```<n>#### Test case one:<n>```python<n>>>> s = Splash()<n>>>> s.main("surface of earth","ground")<n>>>> <n>```<n>And this is the output that you should get:<n>```Coursera<n>Enter any 1 location to make a  splash in and your answer will be:<n>You are about to make a big splashed on the ground.<n><n>Your splash was successful<n>```<n>#### Test Case two:<n>```python<n>> > s = Splash();<n>> > s.main("surfacr of earth", "bridge")<n>```<n>This is the output that you are looking for:<n><n>```Courseran<n>Enter any 1 Location to make a  splasha on and your answer will be:(Enter "D" if you want to exit the program as it will break):<n>Enter any 1  location to  make a splash on the bridge:<n>You are gonna make a splash on bridge location:<n>Your splash was successfull<n>```<n>### Instruction to solve problems<n>> Make sure to run python main.py<n>

Choices:  P: there is no basketball court B: the basketball court is not big enough C: the basketball court has no lights D: the basketball court is located outdoors E: there are no basketball goal posts.<n><n>### Response B<n>### Suffient: He was good at the traditional science but excelled in which subject? Choices:  C: English studies, D: social science B: history C: mathematics<n><n>
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: He fantasied about getting a what while driving to work and the pros and cons of the extra responsibilities and benefits? Choices:  A: new car B: promotion C: boredom D: impatience E: pressure<n>Answer: B: promotion<n><n>Input: He was good at traditional science but excelled at social science, his favorite subject was what? Choices:  A: geography B: history studies C: math D: religion E: dancing<n>Answer: B: history studies<n><n>### Input:What is the worst outcome of an injury? Choices:  A: cause death B: cause bleeding C: falling down D: become infected E: claim insurance<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>Answer: A: cause death<n>```python<n>def getResponse():#Function to answer the questions asked and return the answers<n>#Question 1: What is the worst outcome of injury? <n>def getanswer1():<n>    correctAns = ["A:", "B:", "C:", "D:", "E:"]<n>    #Question 2: His favorite subject was what?<n>    <n>    <n>    <n>    answers=input("Type the letter that answer the questions: ")<n>    while((answers in answers)==False):<n>        print("Wrong Choices:",correctAns)<n>        answers=input("Type A, B, C, or D: ")<n>        <n>    <n>    if(answers in answers):<n>        return ("Answer: "+correctAns[int(answers)-1])<n>    else:<n>        return ("Input incorrect answers")<n>    <n>getanswer1()<n>```<n><n>

Choices:  A: hill B: gorge C: sandplain D: cliff E: mountain<n><n>### Response:		<n>Sam found a giant hole, what might this hole be called as a sandplain?<n><n><n># [Answers](https://github.com//coding-challenge-2/issues<n><n>### Demostration:<n><n>```javascript<n>// Code the function<n><n>function answer(title, content) {<n>  const question = title + "?"<n>  switch (question) {<n>    case "Which is the correct capitalization?":<n>        if (question === "what is the correct capitalization") {<n>          return "Mary was feeling great."<n>        } else {<n>          return "mary was feeling great."<n>         }<n>      case "What does the word 'wild' mean here?":<n>          if (question === "how does wild describe mary") {<n>              return "Mary was a strong swimmer."<n>          } else {<n>            console.log('else statement')<n>          }<n>      case "Which does not belong? Choices:  crop, fish, doughnut, pie, hamburger:":<n>          if (q === "What does not belong? Choice: pie") {<n>              return 'Mary loved fish, pies, hamburgers, and doughnuts because she enjoyed their taste.'<n>          } else { return 'The rest of the choices belonged.'}<n>      case "What is the correct spelling?":<n>           if (content =="I'm sure Mary's mom will help Mary") {<n>              return "'I'm sure Mary\'s mom will help Mary.'"<n>           }<n>           else { return 'else. case' }<n>      case "Please identify the correct punctuation in this paragraph.":<n>            if (content =="marys mom thought mary had been hit by a car") {<n>              return "\'That\'s what Mary\'s mom thought.\' said Mary."<n>            } else { return 'else statement'}<n>      default:<n>          return console.log(error + 'What did you do?')<n>  }<n>}<n>let question = "What are Mary's favorite subjects?";<n>let question = { title: "which of these is correct","content: ".split(",").map(y=>y.replace(/'/g,'"'))};<n>console.log(answer(question));<n><n>```<n><n><n><n>

Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: He fantasied about getting a what while driving to work and the pros and cons of the extra responsibilities and benefits? Choices:  A: new car B: promotion C: boredom D: impatience E: pressure<n>Answer: B: promotion<n><n>Input: He was good at traditional science but excelled at social science, his favorite subject was what? Choices:  A: geography B: history studies C: math D: religion E: dancing<n>Answer: B: history studies<n><n>### Input:what is the goal of going jogging? Choices:  A: heavy breathing B: feel pride C: getting tired D: lose weight E: run away<n><n>### Response:		What is the difference between a dream vacation as a kid and a fantasy vacation?<n><n>### Demostration: a dream vacation is a kid when they don't know what they want. a fantasy vacation when you know exactly what you want.<n><n>### Response I wanted:<n><n>### I am sure a lot of you have fantasied about what you could do with new opportunities, more money and so on. I know I have. I am sure you have too.<n><n>### But what would you do with those new opportunities? Would you feel a sense of pride in your decisions or would you feel anxious about them? Would they be based on sound judgment or would you be prone to impulsiveness?<n><n>### We all have dreams and goals, and it seems most of these have similar tones, but the actual plans and paths of each goal are very different. This is because people have dreams when they don't exactly know what they want, but with more maturity we formulate our dreams into goals. This means our dreams are fantasies and our goals are logical.<n>### A fantasy is a dream, but with implications you understand. For example, going jogging is a type of fantasy. You get a sense of joy from jogging, but you don't necessarily know why you feel that way. If some scientist took all of the endorphins from your brain after a good jog, he could find out.<n><n>### Goals are different and have a different type of meaning and enjoyment. For example, the goal of saving money to buy a house is to have a place where children can grow up. When you buy a house it will not make you as joyful as jogging for one main reason: it is not impromptu. A fantasy is impromptu and it is hard to do things with a goal. If you wanted to get a house, you might have fantasized about it.<n><n>### Both fantasies and dreams are beneficial but more for their emotional value than their realistic value.<n><n>### There are a lot of different ways to classify fantasies. For example, a new car can be a fantasy. It is hard to buy a car because you would have to research many things, like the mileage, horsepower, and the

Choices:  A: attic B: trash C: loft D: closet E: box<n><n>### Response:		<n>1. C: loft and the decorations were there<n>2. B: social science, his favorite was history but he excelled at social science.<n>3. B: Loft.<n><n>The solution can be solved by using recursion.<n><n>---<n><n>### Code:<n>```js<n>function recursiveTree(height) {<n>  for(let i = 0; i <= height; i++) {<n>    for(let j = 0; j <height; j++) {<n>	  return i+ j;<n>      }<n>	  <n>    }<n>  }<n>  <n>```<n><n>### Result:<n>```js<n>recursiveTree(3);<n>5<n><n>recursiveTree(4);<n>4<n><n>recursiveTree(-1);<n>undefined<n>```<n>---<n><n>[Back](../../README.md#top)

Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: He fantasied about getting a what while driving to work and the pros and cons of the extra responsibilities and benefits? Choices:  A: new car B: promotion C: boredom D: impatience E: pressure<n>Answer: B: promotion<n><n>Input: He was good at traditional science but excelled at social science, his favorite subject was what? Choices:  A: geography B: history studies C: math D: religion E: dancing<n>Answer: B: history studies<n><n>### Input:Changing society using a violent conflict is know as a what? Choices:  A: action B: demonstration C: understanding D: vote E: revolution<n><n>### Response:		A:action<n><n>### Input; How can people in the country work with an unstable government to be able to work together while still working independently from government? Choices: <n><n>### Demostration: A: The people should use their own power.<n><n>### Response B: The people should use the power of the government.<n><n>### Input :In order to be successful people need to be able to control and get rid of stress. What are the best ways to deal with stress in your life? Let's list some ways in order from the easiest and quickest to the hardest and most time consuming one? Choices: 1: Exercise 2: Eat healthier 3: Plan ahead 4: Sleep 5: Communication 6: Prayer / meditation <n><n>### Response 1: Plan ahead: The easiest and quickest way to deal with stress.<n><n>A plan may be to help you prepare for a task you need to finish. A plan may be to help remind you about tasks that are due soon.<n><n>### Output 2 Exercise: The second easiest and quickest is exercise. Physical activity has been linked to stress relief as it helps elevate mood and increases blood flow to your brain, which can boost your brain’s ability to cope with the problems in your life. Exercise also releases dopamine, which helps boost your brain’s reward system and makes you feel good. <n><n>There are two types of exercise that can help you deal with stress— aerobic exercise, and resistance training.<n><n>Aerobic exercises are cardio exercises that get your body moving and help increase your blood flow throughout the body. Swimming, running, biking, and walking are all types of aerobic exercise.<n><n>Resistance training, such as lifting weights and bodybuilding, strengthens muscles and can help build endurance.<n><n>### Answer 3 Eat healthier: The third easiest and quickest way is eat healthier.  Having a diet with an abundance of nutrients is linked to lower levels of stress.<n><n>### 4 Sleep: The fourth easiest and quickest way that may be on the list to deal with stress may be sleep. Having enough sleep helps ward off stress on the next day.<n><n>##

Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: He fantasied about getting a what while driving to work and the pros and cons of the extra responsibilities and benefits? Choices:  A: new car B: promotion C: boredom D: impatience E: pressure<n>Answer: B: promotion<n><n>Input: He was good at traditional science but excelled at social science, his favorite subject was what? Choices:  A: geography B: history studies C: math D: religion E: dancing<n>Answer: B: history studies<n><n>### Input:He got a job dancing and waving an advertisement, he got to be outside instead of stuck inside the what? Choices:  A: advertisement B: magazine C: store D: web page E: bus<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>### Code:<n>```cs<n>//Create Lists<n>List<string> ans1 = new List<string>();<n>List<string> answers = new List<string>()<n>{<n>	"A:",<n>	"B:",<n>	"C:",<n>	"D:",<n>	"E:",<n>};<n>char choice = 'A';<n><n>while (true) //Begin<n>{<n>	Console.WriteLine($"Type 1: {ans1[0].ToString()}");<n>	Console.WriteLine(string.Join("\n",answers));<n><n>	foreach (string ans in answers)<n>	{<n>		Console.WriteLine(ans + $" ");<n>	}<n><n><n>	Console.Write($"Input: {choice} ");<n><n>	switch (choice)<n>	{<n><n><n><n>		//If choice equals A, B, C, D, or E<n>		<n>		//The else statement is for when you make a non-number input. It will print you the wrong input<n><n><n>	}<n>	char input = Console.ReadKey();<n><n>	if (input == ConsoleKey.Backspace || input == ConsoleKey.UpArrow) //Backspace or Up Arrow = wrong input<n>	{<n>	//prints incorrect input<n>		Console.Write("Please Try Again\n");<n>	}<n>	else if (input == '\b') //Backspace = wrong input<n>		continue;<n>	else if (int.TryParse(ans1[0].Split('.')[0], out num, System.Globalization.NumberStyles.Integer))<n>	{<n>	ans.Add(ans1[0]);<n>	}<n><n>}<n>```

Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: He fantasied about getting a what while driving to work and the pros and cons of the extra responsibilities and benefits? Choices:  A: new car B: promotion C: boredom D: impatience E: pressure<n>Answer: B: promotion<n><n>Input: He was good at traditional science but excelled at social science, his favorite subject was what? Choices:  A: geography B: history studies C: math D: religion E: dancing<n>Answer: B: history studies<n><n>### Input:He needed to check an electrical connection in the house, where did he look? Choices:  A: telephone network B: freeway C: company D: wall E: airport<n><n>### Response:		<n>A: telephone network<n>### Example Input: <n><n>### Example Response:<n>Input: The first was a what? Choices: A: trolley B: horse C: carriage D: automobile E: motorcycle<n><n>Input: The first city to have what was Springfield? Choices: A : a streetcar B: an electric car C: a bicycle D: a bus E: an automobile<n><n>### Instructions:<n>> Write a program that meets the following requirements:<n>> -<n>> - *Answer a given multiple choice question in a statement of the answer.*<n>> -<n>> *The program should be the following:*<n>> -<n>> ![image](images/image121.png)<n>> -<n>>![image](images1.png)<n><n>### The given input<n><n>> A: He fantasied while driving to work about getting a new car. The pros are the better ride, being less expenses, better insurance, and the cons are the risk, the higher upkeep, and the traffic hazards.<n><n>![image](images2.png)<n><n>> B: He had a great imagination. That was his favorite subject and he was very good at it.<n><n>![image2](image3.png)<n><n><n><n><n># Tests for Multiple Choice Questions Solution<n><n>[1. Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: He fantasied about getting a what while driving to work and the pros and cons of the extra responsibilities and benefits? Choices:  A: new car B: promotion C: boredom D: impatience E: pressure<n>Answer: B: promotion<n><n>Input: He was good at traditional science but excelled at social science, his favorite subject was what? Choices:  A: geography B: history studies C: math D: religion E: dancing<n>Answer: B: history studies<n><n>### Input:What's the nickname of the monster the beauty loved? Choices:  A: geography B: history studies C: math D: religion E: dancing<n>Answer: B: history studies<n><n>### Input:I need a person to milk a cow would a volunteer do this? Choices:  A: cross street B: milk cow C: lose weight D: step forward E: need food<n><n>### Response:		I need a person who can milk a cow. Would you step forward to volunteer?<n><n>### Instructions:<n>The input is below and contains a question/request. The input also contains a choice for each option. What was the pros and cons?<n>A new car<n>B a promotion<n>C boredom<n>D impatience<n>E pressure<n>```<n><n>### Demostration<n>```<n>He fantisied about getting a new car while driving to work, and the pros and cons is extra responsibilities and the benefits is the extra safety of not having repair bills.<n>```<n>### Instruction<n>Same as the above<n><n>Input:  He fantisied about getting what whiledriving to work and the cons and pros is the extra responsibilities for extra safety benefits? Choices:  A: race track B: kentucky derby C: american southwest D: triple crown E: horse derby<n><n>### Response:		<n>A: race track<n><n>### Input2:<n>The professor announced the weekly quiz of what science class? The best types of music in the café are jazz, blues, Rap, country and Hard Rock. My choice would be Jazz. This is because jazz is a music genre and it is a popular kind of music to listen to. The best places to listen to Jazz are coffee shops, restaurants, and bars because the music that they play is not loud so that people do not have to put up there music and get the right attention. Jazz is also played at many of the museums because it is a popular type of music. Jazz was created in The early 1800s and it can also come in a broad variety of style including swing, cool jazz, post-bop, fusion and hip-hop.<n><n>\*\*I added extra information to this answer because of what was asked, i have never seen a question before where the question asked "good" music.<n><n>**Answer: D: Hard rock**<n><n>*Response: *<n><n>\*\*Response:*<n>

What is 10 minus 5 minus 2 equals?<n><n>What you do is, first you convert 5 and 2 into their Roman Numeral forms, then you add up the values with 10 like this:<n>Roman Numeral 2 = II Roman Numeral 5 = V Roman Numeral 10 = X (add the values of II and X)<n>So the missing letter in the above question is V.<n><n>### What you need to do:<n><n>Fill in the missing letters to the following questions.<n><n>What is (add one, two, three)? What is (add four, five, six)? What is (add seven, eight, nine)? What is (add ten, eleven, twelve)?<n><n>### What your task is:<n><n><n><n>What you need to do:  <n>What is 1 plus 3? What is 1 plus 4? What is 13? What is 768201001?

Choices:  A: sign language B: complete sentence C: drink tea D: feel angry E: cross street<n><n>### Response:		<n>You can help a non-verbal person who is trying to communicate using sign language. Sign language may not necessarily be an option for you because some individuals cannot or will not, use sign language to communicate. As a health care worker, you likely work with people from different background, from those who know no sign language to those with advanced use of sign language. You can use non-verbal gestures to communicate with these patients. Gesture use is common in patients with advanced sign language skills and when there is reduced ability to speak (for example, when a patient has had a general anesthetic)<n><n>### Input :He was so proud of his work for his high school's what.
